Memory Management Macros
[Macros]

Detailed Description

Macros controlling the memory management behaviour of coredata objects.


Defines

#define COREDATA_ALLOCATORS_INCLUDE   "eod/memoryutils/stdallocator.h"
#define COREDATA_MEMORY_ALLOCATORS(CLASS_TYPE)

Define Documentation

#define COREDATA_ALLOCATORS_INCLUDE   "eod/memoryutils/stdallocator.h"

Declares the name of the file to include for the memory allocators.

Defining this macro when re-compiling coredata allows the default memory pooling allocators to be replaced with a user defined version.

The file named by this macro should provide definition for the macro COREDATA_MEMORY_ALLOCATORS which needs to define memory management operators. An template would be 

#define COREDATA_MEMORY_ALLOCATORS(CLASS_TYPE)\
    public:\
        void* operator new(size_t size)    { return my_scalar_allocator(size); } \
        void* operator new [](size_t size) { return my_array_allocator(size); } \
        void  operator delete(void* p)     { my_scalar_delete(p); } \
        void  operator delete[](void* p)   { my_array_delete(p); }

Use the following where no definition is specified 

#define COREDATA_MEMORY_ALLOCATORS(CLASS_TYPE)

Definition at line 42 of file stdallocators.h.

#define COREDATA_MEMORY_ALLOCATORS ( CLASS_TYPE   ) 

Defines custom memory allocation member functions.

Add this macro to all non-abstract Serializable classes to provide pooling versions of:

  • operator new(size_t size)
  • operator new(size_t size, int, const char*, int)
  • operator delete(void* p)
  • operator delete(void* p, int, const char *, int)

Parameters:
CLASS_TYPE The name of the class that this macro is within.
See also:
